articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces destroyed 20 Ukrainian drones launched onto the Crimean Peninsula early on Saturday, Russia's defence ministry said.
articles.title: Russia says it destroys 20 Ukrainian drones over Crimea

articles.author: Anne Kauranen
articles.description: Finland should aim to leave the European Union in the long term, but Russia's invasion of Ukraine means European unity should be the priority for now, the far-right Finns Party's Jussi Halla-aho said ahead of a party congress on Saturday.
articles.title: Finns Party mastermind defends long-term goal to leave the EU

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: West Africa's ECOWAS bloc aims to send a parliamentary committee to Niger to meet coup leaders who took power last month and have so far resisted diplomatic pressure to restore civilian rule, a parliament spokesperson said on Saturday.
articles.title: West Africa's ECOWAS parliament in new bid to engage with Niger coup leaders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's central bank chief said on Saturday that all of Iran's frozen funds in South Korea had been unblocked and would be used for "non-sanctioned goods".
articles.title: Iran says unblocked South Korea funds to be used for 'non-sanctioned goods'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The political party of Ecuador's assassinated presidential hopeful, Fernando Villavicencio, picked his would-be vice presidential candidate to replace him as the party standard-bearer on Saturday, just a week before the election.
articles.title: In Ecuador, party of slain presidential candidate picks replacement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia sent a task force to oversee cleanup of parts of the country's Far East on Sunday after Typhoon Khanun passed through the Primorye region, the emergencies ministry in Moscow said.
articles.title: Russia cleans up after Typhoon Khanun floods thousands of homes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian officials welcomed a first Saudi Arabian ambassador on Saturday, they said, in a show of support even as the Gulf kingdom is considering the prospect of establishing formal diplomatic relations with Israel.
articles.title: Palestinians accept first Saudi ambassador

articles.author: Ryan Woo
articles.description: China's foreign ministry on Sunday condemned a brief U.S. visit by Taiwan Vice President William Lai, saying he was a separatist and "troublemaker through and through" and Beijing would take strong steps to protect its sovereignty.
articles.title: China condemns visit of 'troublemaker' Taiwan VP to US

articles.author: Mike Blake, Marco Garcia
articles.description: The scale of the Maui wildfires' destruction came into sharper focus on Saturday, as officials warned the death toll of 80 would likely rise and search teams with cadaver dogs sifted through the charred ruins of Lahaina looking for more victims.
articles.title: Death toll from Maui fires hits at least 80, damages at billions of dollars

articles.author: Deena Beasley
articles.description: Baby Ben Kutschke was diagnosed at three months with spinal muscular atrophy, a rare inherited disorder which is the leading genetic cause of death in infancy globally. It leaves children too weak to walk, talk, swallow or even breathe.
articles.title: Insight: What happens when a $2 million gene therapy is not enough
